channel.title: Editing Cases
channel.description: Hi, I was wondering if, say I see an object like a tunnel or stairway entrance. How do I edit the case? I have edited some cases before by checking where they lead to and searching the coords in client.java, but suppose it doesn't do anything or just blackspaces you? Is there any way to identify a case number by the object or is there not? Anyone know? If you do, please post it, I would be very happy to know. Thanks!

item.title: Editing Cases
item.dc:creator: @pluh1 pluh1
item.description:
@pluh1 wrote:

the soul:

I’m not confused on what a packet is, I’m confused on what he said was horrendous.

I know, I’m not trying to say that I’m just… Well you know, I’m confused. Vengeance, how do I find a packet ID? You mean comments as in (code code code) //(comment) or what?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 28, 2008, 10:46:48 pm[/size][hr]Excuse the double post but I think I figured it out it should be like

case 4499: if (objectX == 2797 && objectY == 3614) { sendMessage("You crawl through the cave"); teleportToX = 2772; teleportToY = 10231; } break;
I think…

Read full topic

item.title: Editing Cases
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

pluh1:

Hmm. Well then I don’t understand how the people who had created the source could have done it in the first place…

Fair comment, the structure is absolutely horrendous.
The switch is on the packet header, which is the ID of the packet, so you want to search for an object click or whatever packet ID. If you don’t know the ID and you don’t know how to find it, it should be named somewhere in the comments. Should be fairly straightforward.

Read full topic
